description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1u1j","text":"This protocol assumes that your MinION run has been completed and the data from the run has been saved. It should take you from raw data to useable FASTA files for each of your fungal barcodes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"331il","text":"This protocol assumes the experiment name is \"FirstRun.\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2b5f9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tbpk","text":"Create a new working folder on the desktop. Ex - FirstRun. Within that create a new folder called \"fast5,\" another called \"Programs,\" and a final one called \"NGSpeciesID.\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38t4i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tntj","text":"I will start by copying all of the fast5 files from:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"840aa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm1k3","text":"/var/lib/minknow/data/./FirstRun/CellName/long_unique_name/fast5 to the newly created fast5 folder on the desktop","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2dgvs","text":"Create an index file from your extraction template papers. This will allow you to link all of your reads with the individual specimens. A template for 7 plates (672 specimens) can be found here:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j27d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f40td","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c483t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bj512","text":"This .xlsx is formatted to utilize the Lab Code and iNaturalist # columns as the only inputs. It will combine these and all of the other columns into a single cell - concatenating them all into the final file name. For the Lab Code, I will typically put these into the iNaturalist \"Voucher Number(s)\" Observational Field, and then export them all at once into a .csv from iNat. This allows me to simply copy and paste many iNat numbers at once, without ever needing to input any of the numbers manually.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35mct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi12g","text":"After editing, save as a tab-delimited text file in the NGSpeciesID folder. You will need to remove most of the final columns from the template. The final output should be saved like this:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7uibb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jpek","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ameqf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"ACA5E1A0F8EE11ECB5326FF9AC29B89D","id":262719,"original_name":"NANOPORE TEMPLATE THIRD RUN.xlsx","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iat9btupp.xlsx"}},"1":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"A5ACC170F8EE11ECB5326FF9AC29B89D","id":262718,"original_name":"Index.txt","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iat8btupp.txt"}}}}
